Description: MITIGATION ACTIVITY TO OFFSET POTENTIAL IMPACTS TO SOUTHWESTERN WILLOW FLYCATCHER

THE WATER BODIES CREATED BY RECLAMATION PROJECTS AND THE CONNECTING WATERWAYS ARE HOME TO NUMEROUS THREATENED AND ENDANGERED SPECIES OF BOTH FISH AND BIRDS. AS STATED IN THE PUBLIC LAW, FOR THE PURPOSE OF RECOGNIZING THE VITAL CONTRIBUTIONS OF OUR WILDLIFE RESOURCES TO THE NATION, THE INCREASING PUBLIC INTEREST AND SIGNIFICANCE THEREOF DUE TO EXPANSION OF OUR NATIONAL ECONOMY. IT IS IN THE PUBLICS INTEREST TO PROTECT THE HABITAT OF ENDANGERED FISH AND SPECIES, AS IT DIRECTLY BENEFITS THE PUBLICS INTEREST AND NATIONAL ECONOMY  AS WELL AS PROTECTING THE PUBLIC WATER BODIES, POWER PLANTS, AND WATER USERS.RECIPIENT SHALL CONTRACT WITH A VENDOR TO CONSTRUCT, INSTALL, AND DELIVER A HOT WATER DIP TANK FOR WATERCRAFT DECONTAMINATION PURPOSES. THE DIP TANK SHALL BE A MOBILE TANK THAT COULD BE TRANSPORTED TO WHEREVER THE RECIPIENT DEEMS THE NEED IS GREATEST AND SHALL BE ABLE TO ACCOMMODATE BOATS UP TO 34 IN LENGTH. THIS DIP TANK WILL BE LOCATED AT PINEVIEW RESERVOIR.  THE DIP TANK SHALL BE FILLED WITH 105F WATER AND THE WATER WOULD BE KEPT AT TEMPERATURE THROUGH A COMBINATION OF PROPANE BURNERS AND VARIOUS HEAT-RETENTION TECHNOLOGIES (HEAT RETAINING PAINT, SHADE BALLS, ETC.) BASED ON STUDIES CITED IN THE UNIFORM MINIMUM PROTOCOLS AND STANDARDS (UMPS 2021), 100  MORTALITY OF ADULT DREISSENID MUSSELS IS ACHIEVED WITH A FIVE-MINUTE EXPOSURE AT A TEMPERATURE OF 105F WATER. TRAILERED BOATS SHALL BE BACKED DOWN INTO THE DIP TANK AND THE BOAT OPERATOR SHALL ACTIVATE THE ENGINE AND ALL RAW WATER SYSTEMS ON BOARD. ALL SYSTEMS SHALL BE SIMULTANEOUSLY FILLED WITH THE HEATED WATER FOR A MINIMUM OF TWO MINUTES, ENSURING ALL ADULT AND LARVAL MUSSELS PRESENT ON IN THE BOAT SYSTEMS ARE KILLED. THE WATER SHALL BE PUMPED OUT OF THESE SYSTEMS AND THEN THE BOAT SHALL BE PULLED FROM THE WATER, COMPLETING THE DECONTAMINATION PROCESS. WATER REMAINING IN THE DIP TANK SHALL BE CONTINUOUSLY FILTERED AND RETURNED TO THE TANK, ENSURING LARVAL MUSSELS, DEBRIS, OIL, AND OTHER POTENTIAL CONTAMINANTS ARE REMOVED PRIOR TO THE ENTRANCE OF THE NEXT WATERCRAFT.A SMALL PORTION OF THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO REPLACE OLDER MOBILE DECONTAMINATION UNITS WITH TWO, MORE EFFICIENT TANKLESS HOT WATER UNITS AT ECHO STATE PARK.

PURPOSE:  AS A BENEFIT TO THE PUBLIC, THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST WITH 1) RESTORATION OF THE NATURAL RIVER RIPARIAN AND AQUATIC HABITAT ECOSYSTEM, 2) AIS MANAGEMENT TO MONITOR AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES IN PYRAMID LAKE AND THE LOWER TRUCKEE RIVER, AND 3) OUTREACH AIMED TOWARDS NATIVE YOUTH INCLUDING, HEAD START PROGRAM, NATCHEZ ELEMENTARY, PYRAMID LAKE JR. SR. HIGH SCHOOL AND LOCAL COMMUNITY. THE PYRAMID LAKE PAIUTE TRIBE (PLPT) CONSIDERS PUBLIC OUTREACH AS INTEGRAL TO AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES MANAGEMENT AND PROTECTING THE NATURAL, CULTURAL, RECREATIONAL, AND ECONOMIC RESOURCES OF THE PLPT. THE PUBLIC OUTREACH EFFORTS OUTLINED BELOW IN TASK 3 WILL PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES TO CREATE PARTNERSHIPS WITH REGIONAL GROUPS ON EFFORTS TO PROVIDE SOCIAL- AND MULTI-MEDIA OUTREACH, WRITTEN MATERIALS, IN-PERSON DEMONSTRATIONS, AND REPORTS ON AIS MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES. ADDITIONAL BENEFITS TO THE PUBLIC INCLUDE RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES BEING PROTECTED SUCH AS FISHING FOR LAHONTAN CUTTHROAT TROUT, SWIMMING, BOATING, AND CAMPING ON THE PLPR. AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES HAVE INVADED MANY RIVERS AND LAKES IN THE U.S. CAUSING SUBSTANTIAL ENVIRONMENTAL AND ECONOMIC IMPACT THAT INCLUDES CLOGGING INTAKE PIPES OF WATER DELIVERY SYSTEMS, LITTERING BEACHES WITH SHARP SHELLS, CREATE DECAYING MATS OF PLANT MATERIAL THAT FOULS BEACHES, CREATE SNAGS FOR BOATERS AND ANGERS, FOULING FACILITIES SUCH AS FISH HATCHERIES AND FISH ELEVATORS, AND INTRODUCING DISEASES TO AQUATIC SYSTEMS DIMINISHING NATIVE FISH POPULATIONS. THE PLPT WILL PROVIDE PUBLIC OUTREACH, TARGETED TOWARDS THE PUBLIC AND TRIBAL COMMUNITY, AS RELATED TO AIS MANAGEMENT TECHNIQUES, THE HARMFUL IMPACTS OF AIS TO THE ECOSYSTEM, HOW TO IDENTIFY AIS OF CONCERN, AND EFFORTS BEING MADE TO PROTECT RESOURCES BY THE PLPT AIS PROGRAM. COLLABORATION WITH PARTNERS WILL BE ONGOING TO IMPLEMENT NEW METHODS OF AIS MANAGEMENT AND TO ENGAGE THE COMMUNITY IN AIS MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:TASK 1 QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN, STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES, RAPID RESPONSE PROGRAMTASK 2 EARLY-DETECTION MONITORINGTASK 3 INCREASE CAPACITY FOR PUBLIC OUTREACHTASK 4 COORDINATE WITH REGIONAL INVASIVE SPECIES GROUPSDELIVERABLE(S) EXPECTED OUTCOME(S):1. DEVELOP QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN AND STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES FOR EARLY-DETECTION MONITORING TO ASSURE QUALITY MEASUREMENTS AND OBSERVATIONS ARE DOCUMENTED  PLAN AND DEVELOP A RAPID RESPONSE PROGRAM2. CONDUCT EARLY-DETECTION MONITORING TO MANAGE AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES ON THE PYRAMID LAKE PAIUTE RESERVATION  ENGAGE IN COORDINATED EARLY-DETECTION EFFORTS THAT INFORM DECISION-MAKING FOR RAPID RESPONSES TO PROMOTE EFFICIENCY AND COST-SAVINGS 3. INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES TO PREVENT NEW INTRODUCTIONS OF AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES THROUGH PUBLIC OUTREACH  DEVELOP NEW MATERIAL AND METHODS FOR DISTRIBUTION4. TRAIN AND COLLABORATE WITH REGIONAL PARTNERS AND AGENCIES TO BENEFIT AIS PROGRAM ACTIVITIES THROUGH INCREASED WORK EFFICIENCY AND SHARED EXPERTISEBENEFICIARIES: THE PUBLIC

AWARD PURPOSE:THE CONFEDERATED TRIBES OF THE COLVILLE RESERVATION (CTCR) HAS ESTABLISHED AN AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES (AIS) PROGRAM UTILIZING PARTNERSHIPS AND FUNDING FROM RECLAMATION, LAKE ROOSEVELT NATIONAL PARK (NPS) AND THE BUREAU OF INDIAN AFFAIRS. THESE PARTNERSHIPS HAVE ALLOWED THE CTCR TO ESTABLISH A SMALL AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES TEAM WHO PARTICIPATE IN LOCAL AND REGIONAL INVASIVE MUSSEL MEETINGS, MONITOR 10 KEY LOCATIONS ALONG LAKE ROOSEVELT AND LAKE RUFUS WOODS (SUBSTRATES, EDNA, VELIGER, AND WATER QUALITY MONITORING), ACQUIRED TWO MUSSEL WASH-DOWN STATIONS, POSTED CLEAN DRAIN DRY SIGNS AT ALL TRIBAL BOAT LAUNCHES, AND PROVIDE PUBLIC OUTREACH MATERIAL VIA SOCIAL MEDIA ON THE DANGERS OF INVASIVE MUSSELS. PREVIOUS FUNDING FROM RECLAMATION HAS ALLOWED THE TRIBE TO HIRE ONE FULL-TIME AIS BIOLOGIST FOR THE TEAM.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE CTCR WILL MAINTAIN AND OPERATE AN AIS PROGRAM UTILIZING PARTNERSHIPS AND FUNDING.STAFF WILL PARTICIPATE IN LOCAL AND REGIONAL INVASIVE MUSSEL MEETINGS, MONITOR 10 SAMPLING LOCATIONS ALONG LAKE ROOSEVELT AND LAKE RUFUS WOODS, ACQUIRE TWO MUSSEL WASH-DOWN STATIONS, POST CLEAN DRAIN DRY SIGNS AT ALL TRIBAL BOAT LAUNCHES AND PROVIDE PUBLIC OUTREACH MATERIAL VIA SOCIAL MEDIA ON THE DANGERS OF INVASIVE MUSSELS.CTCR WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR LAKE ROOSEVELT IN COLLABORATION WITH WASHINGTON DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE, SPOKANE TRIBE OF INDIANS, NPS, AND RECLAMATION.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: CTCR DESIRES TO FULLY PARTICIPATE IN THE REGIONAL AIS COORDINATION MEETINGS, BE A MEMBER OF THE REGIONAL AIS RESPONSE TEAM, PARTICIPATE IN THE TRAINING, AND ENSURE STAFF ARE PROPERLY TRAINED TO DETECT AND HANDLE AN INVASIVE MUSSEL SIGHTING.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PUBLIC BENEFITS INCLUDE:  INCREASED AIS PROTECTION FOR THE COLUMBIA RIVER BASIN WATERS.  PREVENTING AIS THROUGH WATERCRAFT INSPECTIONS  IMPROVED WATER QUALITY  ENHANCED FISH HABITAT AND POPULATION  IMPROVED AIS MONITORING EFFORTS TO REDUCE INVASIVE MUSSEL DEVASTATION.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): N A

AWARD PURPOSE:MONITORING JUVENILE SALMON DISPERSAL IN STREAMS IS IMPORTANT FOR UNDERSTANDING THE BIOLOGICAL IMPLICATIONS OF STREAM HABITAT RESTORATION AND FOR DESIGNING FUTURE ACTIONS THAT WILL OPTIMALLY MATCH HABITAT USAGE DURING FRESHWATER LIFE STAGES. GENETICS-BASED PARENTAGE-BASED TAGGING (PBT) IS TECHNIQUE FOR MONITORING DISPERSAL OF JUVENILE FISHES TOO SMALL FOR TAGGING. PBT TECHNIQUES PAIR JUVENILES TO INDIVIDUAL PARENTS, THEREBY INFORMING HATCH LOCATION WHEN THE SPAWNING LOCATION OF THE FEMALE PARENT IS KNOWN. THIS WILL PROVIDE INSIGHT INTO THE SPAWNING PATTERNS AND DISTRIBUTION OF ADULTS, WHICH WILL BE USEFUL FOR UNDERSTANDING THE OVERALL POPULATION DYNAMICS OF THE CHINOOK IN THE AREA.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT WILL MONITOR JUVENILE SALMON DISPERSAL IN STREAMS TO MORE UNDERSTAND THE BIOLOGICAL IMPLICATIONS OF STREAM HABITAT RESTORATION AND FOR DESIGNING FUTURE ACTIONS THAT WILL OPTIMALLY MATCH HABITAT USAGE DURING FRESHWATER LIFE STAGES. GENETICS-BASED PARENTAGE-BASED TAGGING (PBT) IS TECHNIQUE FOR MONITORING DISPERSAL OF JUVENILE FISHES TOO SMALL FOR TAGGING. PBT TECHNIQUES PAIR JUVENILES TO INDIVIDUAL PARENTS, THEREBY INFORMING HATCH LOCATION WHEN THE SPAWNING LOCATION OF THE FEMALE PARENT IS KNOWN. THIS WILL PROVIDE INSIGHT INTO THE SPAWNING PATTERNS AND DISTRIBUTION OF ADULTS, WHICH WILL BE USEFUL FOR UNDERSTANDING THE OVERALL POPULATION DYNAMICS OF THE CHINOOK IN THE AREA.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A COMPREHENSIVE UNDERSTANDING OF SPATIAL ECOLOGY OF SPRING CHINOOK SALMON IN CATHERINE CREEK BY MAPPING THE SPATIALLY CONTINUOUS DISTRIBUTION OF SPAWNING HO VS. NO FISH, DETERMINING RIVERSCAPE DISPERSAL PATTERNS OF THE JUVENILE OFFSPRING IN RELATION TO RECENT RESTORATION PROJECTS, COMPARING RELATIVE REPRODUCTIVE SUCCESS OF INDIVIDUAL CHINOOK SPAWNERS AND SPAWNER PAIRS, AND IDENTIFYING PATTERNS IN PROGENY MIGRATION TIMING AND SURVIVAL IF SAMPLE SIZE ALLOWS. ADDITIONALLY, THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO PROVIDE A VALUABLE OPPORTUNITY FOR A GRADUATE STUDENT TO LEAD THE RESEARCH AND DEVELOP THEIR SKILLS, WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR ADDITIONAL OBJECTIVES TO EMERGE DURING THE COURSE OF THE STUDY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE BENEFICIAL RECOMMENDATIONS TO RESTORATION PRACTITIONERS FOR THE PLACEMENT AND DESIGN OF FUTURE PROJECTS TO ENSURE THAT THE FINDINGS ARE APPLIED IN A PRACTICAL WAY, WHICH WILL BENEFIT THE MANAGEMENT AND CONSERVATION OF THE CHINOOK POPULATION.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): N A

ARIZONA GAME AND FISH WILL SUPPORT HABITAT IMPROVEMENTS ON THE NATIVE FISH POND AT GRASSLANDS WA. FUNDING WILL BE PRIMARILY USED TO PURCHASE SUPPLIES MATERIALS, AS WELL AS CONTRACTOR LABOR FOR DELIVERY INSTALLATION. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CREATE ADEQUATE HABITAT TO SUPPORT THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A SELF-SUSTAINING REFUGIUM POPULATION OF LITTLE COLORADO SPINEDACE. THIS POPULATION WOULD THEN ALLOW FOR FUTURE TRANSLOCATION EFFORTS OF LITTLE COLORADO SPINEDACE TO OCCUR IN THE UPPER LOWER COLORADO RIVER BASIN. THIS PROJECT WILL BE COMPLETED BY IMPLEMENTING THE FOLLOWING TASKS:TASK 1: ADD SUITABLE SUBSTRATE TYPES INTO THE ARTIFICIAL STREAM AND CONNECT THE ARTIFICIAL STREAM AND POND TO ALLOW FISH TO BE ABLE TO MOVE BETWEEN THESE HABITATS.TASK 2: PURCHASE AND INSTALL WATER PUMPS TO CONNECT AND CREATE FLOW BETWEEN THE ARTIFICIAL STREAM AND THE POND TO PROMOTE SPINEDACE SPAWNING AND JUVENILE REARING.TASK 3: INSTALL STREAM GRAVEL AND CONNECT STREAM TO THE POND AND CREATE FLOW BETWEEN THE ARTIFICIAL STREAM AND THE POND TO PROMOTE SPINEDACE SPAWNING AND JUVENILE REARING.

THE LFCC WEST GATES WILL BE PURCHASED AND INSTALLED AT THE RM 60 SITE IN THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE.  THE PROJECT CONSISTS OF INSTALLING AN AUTOMATED GATES TO CONTROL FLOW FROM THE LFCC THROUGH CULVERTS TO THE LFCC WEST.  THE PROJECT HELPS CONSERVE HABITAT IN THE LFCC WEST WHILE CREATING HABITAT IN THE RIO GRANDE AND HELP PREVENT OVER BANKING WATER LOSSES THAT OCCUR WITHIN THE LFCC WEST BY REDUCING FLOW TO THE LFCC WEST.

AWARD PURPOSE: THE WID NETWORK IN MONTANA ADDRESSES HIGH-RISK CORRIDORS FOR WATERCRAFT BRINGING AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES (AIS) INTO MONTANA AND ALSO ADDRESSES AIS ON WATERCRAFT THAT ARE TRAVELING BEYOND MONTANA TO OTHER WATERS IN THE NORTHWEST. MONTANA FISH WILDLIFE AND PARKS (FWP) WILL PURCHASE ON-DEMAND HOT WATER DECONTAMINATION UNITS AND LIGHTED DIGITAL MESSAGE BOARD SIGNS FOR MONTANA WID STATIONS. THE ADDITION OF NEW DECONTAMINATION UNITS AND ENHANCED SIGNAGE WILL STRENGTHEN MTS AIS PREVENTION EFFORT.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FWP WILL PURCHASE FOUR ON-DEMAND HOT WATER DECONTAMINATION UNITS, TO BE INSTALLED AT INSPECTION STATIONS. DECONTAMINATION UNITS WILL BE INSTALLED AT HIGH-PRIORITY WATERCRAFT INSPECTION STATIONS OPERATED BY FWP STAFF AND PARTNERS INCLUDING TRIBES, COUNTIES, AND CONSERVATION DISTRICTS.FWP WILL ALSO PURCHASE FOUR LIGHTED DIGITAL MESSAGE BOARDS TO IMPROVE VISIBILITY OF ROADSIDE WID STATIONS. THESE SIGNS WILL BE PLACED AT PRIORITY WID STATIONS TO INCREASE VISIBILITY AND IMPROVE BOATER COMPLIANCE. LIGHTED DIGITAL MESSAGE BOARDS WILL BE PLACED AT PRIORITY WID STATIONS TO HELP ADDRESS COMPLIANCE ISSUES.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: THE ADDITION OF NEW DECONTAMINATION UNITS AND ENHANCED SIGNAGE WILL STRENGTHEN MONTANAS AIS PREVENTION EFFORT. WATERCRAFT INSPECTIONS ARE A WAY OF INTERCEPTING VESSELS AND EQUIPMENT THAT HAVE POTENTIAL TO SPREAD AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES (AIS) AND TO DECONTAMINATE THEM (IF NECESSARY).INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE AMERICAN PUBLIC IN THE NORTHWEST. INSPECTION STATIONS ARE THE FIRST LINE OF DEFENSE TO STOP THE SPREAD OF AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): N A

AWARD PURPOSE: THE PUBLIC PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO GATHER AND ASSESS IDAHO RESIDENTS PERCEPTIONS , BELIEFS AND ATTITUDES TOWARD SALMONID RECOVERY IN ORDER TO ANTICIPATE CONFLICT AND GUIDE POLICY IMPLEMENTATION.  THIS WILL HELP THE EXPERTS IN SALMONID RECOVERY KNOW HOW TO ACCOMPLISH SALMONID RECOVERY WHILE ACCOMMODATING PUBLIC OPINION.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT SHALL GATHER AND ASSESS IDAHO RESIDENTS PERCEPTIONS, BELIEFS AND ATTITUDES TOWARD SALMONID RECOVERY.  THIS PROJECT WILL CARRY OUT STAGE 3 OF THE IDAHO RESIDENTS SALMONID RECOVERY STUDY WHICH CONSIST OF A GENERAL PUBLIC DISCRETE CHOICE EXPERIMENTAL DESIGN.  THIS SURVEY WILL UTILIZE A DISCRETE CHOICE EXPERIMENT (DCE) WHEREIN DECISION MAKING TRADE-OFFS ARE CAPTURED IN COMPLEX CASES AND WHEN ANALYZED IN RELATION TO THE VALUES PERCEPTIONS SURVEY OF STAGES 1 AND 2, HELPING TO PROVIDE INSIGHT INTO THE SOCIAL DECISION MAKING AROUND SALMONID RECOVERY THAT CAN HELP GUIDE FUTURE RECOVERY PROJECTS, POLICY IMPLEMENTATION, AND COMMUNITY COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS.  EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE UNDERSTANDING OF THE PUBLICS PERCEPTIONS OF SALMONID RECOVERY ASSISTING EXPERTS AND POLICY MAKERS TO CREATE RECOVERY PLANS THAT BALANCE PUBLIC PERCEPTION AND BEST PRACTICES.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES WILL BE THE PUBLIC WHO WILL BE ABLE TO ENJOY SALMON AND STEELHEAD IN FUTURE GENERATIONS, AS WELL AS TRIBES WHO RELY ON THE ANNUAL RETURN OF SALMONIDS TO THE RIVER SYSTEMS.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): NONE

THE BUREAU OF RECLAMATION (RECLAMATION) AND THE SIERRA SOIL AND WATER CONSERVATION DISTRICT (SSWCD) ENTERED INTO A MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING (MOU) APRIL 2003, FORMING THE BASIS OF COOPERATIVE WORK FOR HERBICIDE TREATMENT OF INVASIVE VEGETATION CONTROL MANAGEMENT ON THE RIO GRANDE IN NEW MEXICO.  AN ADDENDUM WAS ADDED TO THE 2003 MOU TO EXPAND THE COOPERATIVE WORK TO INCLUDE ADDITIONAL NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES ON RECLAMATION PROJECT LANDS IN JANUARY OF 2023. THE 2023 MODIFICATION STIPULATES THAT SSWCD MAY COMPLETE ADDITIONAL WORK INCLUDING MAPPING, MONITORING, RESTORATION WORK SUCH AS HARVESTING AND PLANTING OF COTTONWOOD OR WILLOW POLES, AND OTHER NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES AS AGREED UPON BETWEEN THE PARTIES AS TASKS FUNDED BY RECLAMATION THROUGH GRANTS, AGREEMENTS OR CONTRACTS, SUBJECT TO FUNDING AVAILABILITY.WORK MAY INCLUDE MAPPING, MONITORING, RESTORATION WORK SUCH AS HARVESTING AND PLANTING OF COTTONWOOD OR WILLOW POLES, AND OTHER NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES.

THE PROPOSED PROJECT HAS SIGNIFICANT PUBLIC PURPOSE BECAUSE ITS FINDINGS WILL INFORM RECOVERY EFFORTS FOR ESA-LISTED LOST RIVER AND SHORTNOSE SUCKERS, AND MAY ALSO INFORM ASSOCIATED WATER MANAGEMENT DECISIONS. FOR EXAMPLE, IF THE MAJORITY OF KFNFH SUCKERS WHOSE TAGS ARE DETECTED (FOUND DEAD) ON BIRD COLONIES CAME FROM CERTAIN RELEASE TIMES OR LOCATIONS, THE RELEASE STRATEGY COULD BE MODIFIED TO RELEASE FISH AT A TIME WHEN FEWER AVIAN PREDATORS ARE PRESENT, OR IN A LOCATION WHERE SURVIVAL RATE OF KFNFH SUCKERS IS HIGHER. THIS HAS SIGNIFICANT PUBLIC BENEFIT TO THE KLAMATH TRIBES, WHO HAVE A DIRECT SPIRITUAL, PHYSICAL, AND SOCIAL CONNECTION WITH THE CWAAM (LOST RIVER SUCKER) AND QAPDO (SHORTNOSE SUCKER) AS THE PRESENCE OF THEIR PEOPLE IS DIRECTLY TIED TO THESE FISHES. OTHER MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC IN THE KLAMATH BASIN WILL ALSO BENEFIT, AS RECOVERY OF THESE SPECIES COULD RESULT IN MORE FLEXIBLE BIOLOGICAL OPINIONS, AND POSSIBLY EVEN DE-LISTING OF THESE SPECIES- THOUGH THE LATTER IS SEEMS HIGHLY UNLIKELY IN THE NEAR FUTURE. IN THE SHORT TERM, POLICY OR WATER MANAGEMENT DECISIONS MAY BE INFORMED IF PREDATION RATES ARE FOUND TO VARY WITH SURFACE ELEVATIONS. DATA THAT MAY INFORM WATER MANAGEMENT DECISIONS, OR DATA THAT MAY INFORM SPECIES RECOVERY WILL PROVIDE SIGNIFICANT PUBLIC BENEFIT BECAUSE WATER IS A LIMITED RESOURCE IN THE KLAMATH BASIN, AND THE TRAJECTORY OF ESA-LISTED SPECIES THAT LIVE IN THAT WATER STRONGLY INFLUENCE WATER MANAGEMENT DECISIONS. OBJECTIVE 1. COLONY SURVEYS. ANNUALLY COORDINATE AND CONDUCT THREE PISCIVOROUS COLONIAL WATERBIRD AERIAL SURVEYS AND ASSOCIATED COLONY COUNTS IN THE UPPER KLAMATH BASIN. OBJECTIVE 2. DATA ANALYSIS AND REPORTING. COMPILE PIT AND RADIO TAG DETECTION DATA, ASSESS PREDATION RATES, AND PRODUCE DRAFT AND FINAL TECHNICAL REPORTS ANNUALLY.OBJECTIVE 3.  ESTIMATE SURVIVAL RELATIVE TO COVARIATES. ASSESS SUCKER SURVIVAL RELATIVE TO COVARIATES USING CAPTURE-RECAPTURE-RECOVERY DATASETS FROM 2018 TO 2027 AND SUMMARIZE RESULTS IN A DRAFT AND FINAL TECHNICAL REPORT (2025).OBJECTIVE 4. FINAL DATA COMPILATION AND SYNTHESIS REPORT. PROVIDE COMPILED DATASETS (PREDATION, SURVIVAL, COVARIATE) AND ASSESS TRENDS IN SUCKER PREDATION AND SURVIVAL FOR ALL LIFE STAGES (WILD JUVENILES, WILD ADULTS, SARP JUVENILES  TO THE EXTENT POSSIBLE) AND STUDY YEARS (2009-2027) AS A SYNTHESIS REPORT FOR MANAGERS.

AWARD PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IF TO RESTORE INSTREAM FLOW, FOR THE BENEFIT OF AQUATIC SPECIES, IN THE YAKIMA RIVER BY PIPING AND LINING THE NORTH BRANCH CANAL.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS AGREEMENT WILL ELIMINATE SEEPAGE LOSSES AND CONSERVE WATER IN 68,425 FEET OF LEAKING CANAL BY LINING AND PIPING THE AREAS SHOWN IN FIGURE 2. THE EXISTING NORTH BRANCH CANAL BOTTOM IS AN EARTHEN MIX OF COBBLES, FINE SILTS AND SANDS, AND BASALT BEDROCK. KRD IDENTIFIED SEEPAGE LOSSES FROM WATER MEASUREMENTS, VISUAL OBSERVATIONS CANAL BANK SEEPAGE, AND VEGETATION GROWTH DOWNSLOPE OF CANAL BANKS. THE CONSTRUCTION ASPECTS OF THE LINING AND PIPING PROJECT WILL IMPROVE THE SITES ACCESS, STAGING AREAS, AND ROADWAYS.  THIS WILL INCLUDE CLEARING, GRUBBING AND ROUGH GRADING OF THE ACCESS ROADS.  THE CANAL WILL BE EXCAVATED AND REGRADED AND A GEOMEMBRANE LINER WITH CONCRETE COVER FOR THE LINING PROJECTS OR INSTALL PIPE AND BACKFILL FOR PIPING PROJECTS WILL BE INSTALLED. NEW TURNOUTS FOR DELIVERED WATER WILL BE INSTALLED. FENCING WILL BE INSTALLED FOR THE PROTECTION OF PEOPLE, ANIMALS, AND THE WORKSITES, AND LANDOWNER FENCING REMOVED OR DAMAGED DURING THE PROJECT WILL BE REPLACED. SCADA STATIONS WILL BE INSTALLED WHERE NEEDED TO DELIVER SAVED WATER AND VERIFY THE WATER SAVINGS.THREE SECTIONS OF CANAL ARE IDENTIFIED AS TOP-PRIORITY FOR CONSERVATION EFFORTS AND WILL BE IMPLEMENTED WITH THIS FUNDING. THIS IS ESTIMATED TO BE 2,773 ACRE-FEET OF WATER ANNUALLYINTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY WILL BE THE PUBLIC AS THEY WILL CONTINUE TO BE ABLE TO ENJOY AND UTILIZE THESE SPECIES INTO THE FUTURE. AWARD PURPOSE:AT THE REQUEST OF THE U.S. BUREAU OF RECLAMATION, AN AD HOC COMMITTEE OF THE NATIONAL ACADEMIES OF SCIENCES, ENGINEERING, AND MEDICINE (NASEM) WILL CONDUCT TWO BIENNIAL REVIEWS OF THE MONITORING, MODELING, AND OTHER RELEVANT SCIENTIFIC ACTIVITIES AND INITIATIVES THAT SUPPORT THE LONG-TERM OPERATIONS OF THE CENTRAL VALLEY PROJECT (CVP). THE NEEDS OF SPECIES LISTED UNDER THE ESA DRIVE THE OPERATION OF THE CVP INCLUDING: THE SOUTHERN DISTINCT POPULATION SEGMENT OF NORTH AMERICAN GREEN STURGEON, CALIFORNIA CENTRAL VALLEY STEELHEAD TROUT, CENTRAL VALLEY SPRING-RUN CHINOOK SALMON, SACRAMENTO RIVER WINTER-RUN CHINOOK SALMON, AND DELTA SMELT.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS AGREEMENT ARE TO CONDUCT TWO BIENNIAL REVIEWS OF THE MONITORING, MODELING, AND OTHER RELEVANT SCIENTIFIC ACTIVITIES AND INITIATIVES THAT SUPPORT THE LONG-TERM OPERATIONS OF THE CVP. EVERY TWO YEARS, THE REPORTS STEMMING FROM THIS STUDY WILL ASSESS THE PROGRESS OF THE CVP IN MEETING ITS OPERATIONAL AND OTHER GOALS.PROJECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: EVERY TWO YEARS, THE REPORTS STEMMING FROM THIS STUDY WILL ASSESS THE PROGRESS OF THE CVP IN MEETING ITS OPERATIONAL AND OTHER GOALS. EACH FINAL REPORT SHOULD BE USEFUL TO RECLAMATION, OTHER RELEVANT FEDERAL AGENCIES, THE DELTA STEWARDSHIP COUNCIL, CALIFORNIA STATE AGENCIES, REGIONAL INDUSTRY, AGRICULTURAL INTERESTS, ENVIRONMENTAL GROUPS, AND MANY OTHER STAKEHOLDERS. THE REPORTS WILL BE PUBLISHED AND DISSEMINATED BY THE NATIONAL ACADEMIES PRESS. THEY WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC WITHOUT RESTRICTION AND WILL BE PREPARED ELECTRONICALLY TO ENSURE DISTRIBUTION TO THE PUBLIC AND ALL RELEVANT PARTIES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE NASEM REVIEW WILL PROVIDE AN EXTERNAL AND OBJECTIVE SCIENTIFIC REVIEW OF THE SCIENCE, MODELING, AND DECISION-MAKING TOOLS AND STRATEGIES BEING USED TO SUPPORT CVP MANAGEMENT. IT WILL PRIORITIZE AND PROVIDE RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPROVEMENT IN THESE AREAS AND IDENTIFY SCIENTIFIC ISSUES THAT MAY IMPACT PROGRESS IN ACHIEVING THE GOALS OF THE LONG-TERM OPERATION OF THE CVP. THE COLORADO DUST-ON-SNOW (CODOS) PROGRAM PERFORMS DUST-ON-SNOW MONITORING THROUGHOUT THE COLORADO MOUNTAINS AND PROVIDES THE COLORADO RIVER WATER MANAGEMENT COMMUNITY AND OTHER INTERESTED STAKEHOLDERS INCLUDING ENVIRONMENTAL AND RECREATIONAL GROUPS, NATIVE AMERICAN INDIAN NATIONS AND COMMUNITIES, STATE AGENCIES, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WITH TIMELY ANALYSES AND FORECASTS OF DUST EFFECTS AND SNOWMELT TIMING RATES. THE INFORMATION PROVIDED THROUGH THIS PROJECT BENEFITS BY INCREASING THE KNOWLEDGE OF THE NATURAL SYSTEM WITH THE POTENTIAL TO IMPROVE RUNOFF FORECASTS, THEREBY IMPROVING OPERATIONS OF ORGANIZATIONS.THE CODOC PROGRAM OBJECTIVE IS TO PERFORM DUST-ON-SNOW MONITORING THROUGHOUT THE COLORADO MOUNTAINS BY MONITORING THE PRESENCE/ABSENCE OF DUST LAYERS. ALSO, USING THOSE OBSERVATIONS, AND DATA FROM NEARBY SNOWPACK TELEMETRY (SNOTEL) SITES, AND WEATHER FORECASTS. THE CODOS PROGRAM ISSUES A SERIES OF ANALYSES OF HOW DUST-ON-SNOW IS LIKELY TO INFLUENCE SNOWMELT TIMING AND RATES DURING THE RUNOFF SEASON.THE RECIPIENT WILL PERFORM FIELD WORK AT ELEVEN SAMPLE SITES. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL 1) DOCUMENT DUST-ON-SNOW LAYERS AND OTHER SNOWPACK CONDITIONS IN ANNUAL TECHNICAL REPORT; 2) MONITOR ASSOCIATED SNOWPACK TELEMETRY (SNOTEL) SITES BETWEEN VISITS, 3) EVALUATE REGIONAL HYDROLOGIC DATA, AND 4) CONTACT COLORADO DUST-ON-SNOW-PROGRAM (CODOS) PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS AND OTHER LOCAL OBSERVERS FOR OTHER OBSERVATIONS.THE PRIMARY DELIVERABLE IS TO PROVIDE TIMELY INFORMATION ABOUT DUST-ON-SNOW CONDITIONS IN WATERSHEDS, THROUGH A SERIES OF OPERATIONAL DUST-ON-SNOW CONDITION UPDATES, ALERTS, AND EMAILS TAILORED TO OPERATIONS, WHICH WILL BE AVAILABLE PUBLICLY VIA PROJECT WEBSITE (CODOS.ORG).THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS PROPOSED FOR THIS AGREEMENT.

PURPOSE:THE RECIPIENT HAS PROPOSED TO RECLAMATION TO PROVIDE FOR THE DETECTION AND MONITORING OF HARMFUL ALGAL BLOOMS (HABS), WHICH HAS A DIRECT BENEFIT TO THE PUBLIC BY PROVIDING WATER MANAGERS ADVANCE NOTIFICATION OF IMPENDING ALGAL BLOOMS THAT MAY PRODUCE CYANOTOXINS THAT ARE HARMFUL, EVEN FATAL, TO HUMAN AND ANIMAL LIFE THAT COME IN CONTACT WITH RECLAMATION WATERS IMPACTED BY HABS.2. ACTIVITES:BUILD AND DEPLOY EIGHT COMPACT, LOW-COST, ULTRAVIOLET LIGHT LED OPTICAL SENSORS FOR IN-SITU DETECTION OF ALGAL FLUORESCENCE. DAILY REPORTING FOR THE REAL-TIME ASPECT OF THE PROJECT WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF LESS FREQUENT DATA TRANSFERS DEPENDING ON OBSERVED BLOOM DEVELOPMENT BY CLOSE OF EACH BUSINESS DAY. DAILY MEANS, MEDIANS, AND RANGES OF ALGAL FLUORESCENCE WILL BE COMPUTED BY UC DAVIS AND SENT TO BUREAU OF RECLAMATION ENVIRONMENTAL AFFAIR'S ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING UNIT BRANCH CHIEF. SENSOR MAINTENANCE WILL PRIMARILY BE TO CHECK FOR SENSOR FOULING AND TO CALIBRATE USING ALGAL SENSORS TO CHECK FOR SENSOR DRIFT AND WILL OCCUR AT A FREQUENCY NECESSARY TO MAINTAIN DATA QUALITY.3. OUTCOME: ALLOWING FOR AN EARLY DETECTION OF CYANOTOXIN HARMFUL ALGAL BLOOM (HAB) EVENTS, WHICH PROVIDE WATER MANAGERS A VALUABLE TOOL TO MINIMIZE THE DEVASTATING ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS INHERENT IN HAB EVENTS. THE DETECTION OF HABS WILL REDUCE OR MINIMIZE IMPACTS TO WATER QUALITY, WITH A DIRECT BENEFIT TO FISH, WILDLIFE, RECREATION, AND POTENTIALLY AGRICULTURE.4. BENEFICIARY: THE GENERAL PUBLIC.5. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

THE PURPOSE OF THE PROPOSED CIBOLA HABITAT RESTORATION LONG-TERM MONITORING PROJECT IS TO QUANTIFY WILDLIFE USE AND PROJECT CO-BENEFITS OF THE ESTABLISHED HABITAT TEN YEARS AFTER MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES CEASED. THE PROJECT WILL COMPARE WILDLIFE AND CO-BENEFITS OF THE RIVER PARTNERS RESTORATION AREA TO ADJACENT UN-RESTORED LANDS. SPECIFIC PROJECT OBJECTIVES ARE TO: 1) COMPARE AVIAN, INSECT POLLINATOR, SMALL MAMMAL, HERPETOFAUNA, AND VEGETATION COMMUNITY COMPOSITION IN RESTORED AND UN-RESTORED AREAS, 2) QUANTIFY MICRO-CLIMATE DIFFERENCES IN RESTORED AND UN-RESTORED AREAS TO DESCRIBE CLIMATE REFUGIA BENEFITS OF HABITAT RESTORATION, 3) DESCRIBE WILDLIFE USE AND CLIMATE REFUGIA BENEFITS IN THE CONTEXT OF CONSUMPTIVE WATER USE BY EVAPOTRANSPIRATION OF RESTORED AND UN-RESTORED VEGETATION COMMUNITIES, AND 4) SHARE RESULTS, CONCLUSIONS AND LESSONS LEARNED TO IMPROVE RIPARIAN HABITAT RESTORATION ON THE ALAMO AND NEW RIVERS AND ELSEWHERE ACROSS THE REGION.THE LESSONS LEARNED THROUGH THIS EFFORT WILL DIRECTLY INFORM RESTORATION PLANS IN DEVELOPMENT FOR RIVERSIDE LANDS ALONG THE ALAMO AND NEW RIVERS AS WELL AS FUTURE RESTORATION ACROSS THE REGION.

THE WATER BODIES CREATED BY RECLAMATION PROJECTS AND THE CONNECTING WATERWAYS ARE HOME TO NUMEROUS THREATENED AND ENDANGERED SPECIES OF BOTH FISH AND BIRDS. AS STATED IN THE PUBLIC LAW, "FOR THE PURPOSE OF RECOGNIZING THE VITAL CONTRIBUTIONS OF OUR WILDLIFE RESOURCES TO THE NATION, THE INCREASING PUBLIC INTEREST AND SIGNIFICANCE THEREOF DUE TO EXPANSION OF OUR NATIONAL ECONOMY-" IT IS IN THE PUBLIC'S INTEREST TO PROTECT THE HABITAT OF ENDANGERED FISH AND SPECIES, AS IT DIRECTLY BENEFITS THE PUBLIC'S INTEREST AND NATIONAL ECONOMY; AS WELL AS PROTECTING THE PUBLIC WATER BODIES, POWER PLANTS, AND WATER USERS.RECIPIENT SHALL CONTRACT WITH A VENDOR TO CONSTRUCT, INSTALL, AND OPERATE A HOT WATER DIP TANK FOR WATERCRAFT DECONTAMINATION PURPOSES. THE DIP TANK SHALL BE A MOBILE TANK THAT COULD BE TRANSPORTED TO WHEREVER THE RECIPIENT DEEMS THE NEED IS GREATEST AND SHALL BE ABLE TO ACCOMMODATE BOATS UP TO 26' IN LENGTH. INITIALLY, THIS TANK WOULD BE LOCATED WITHIN THE GROUNDS OF BULLFROG MARINA AT LAKE POWELL. NATIONAL PARKS SERVICE HAS AGREED TO PARTNER WITH THE RECIPIENT ON THIS PROJECT TO ENSURE THE NECESSARY PERMITS ARE ACQUIRED AND THE PROJECT HAS DEDICATED SPACE WITHIN GLEN CANYON NATIONAL RECREATION AREA.THE DIP TANK SHALL BE FILLED WITH 110-F WATER AND THE WATER WOULD BE KEPT AT TEMPERATURE THROUGH A COMBINATION OF PROPANE BURNERS AND VARIOUS HEAT-RETENTION TECHNOLOGIES (HEAT RETAINING PAINT, SHADE BALLS, ETC.) BASED ON STUDIES CITED IN THE UNIFORM MINIMUM PROTOCOLS AND STANDARDS (UMPS 2021), 100% MORTALITY OF ADULT MUSSELS IS ACHIEVED WITH WATER AT 110-F. TRAILERED BOATS WOULD BE BACKED DOWN INTO THE DIP TANK AND THE BOAT OPERATOR WOULD ACTIVATE THE ENGINE AND ALL RAW WATER SYSTEMS ON BOARD. ALL SYSTEMS WILL BE SIMULTANEOUSLY FILLED WITH THE HEATED WATER FOR A MINIMUM OF TWO MINUTES, ENSURING ALL ADULT AND LARVAL MUSSELS PRESENT ON/IN THE BOAT SYSTEMS ARE KILLED. THE WATER WOULD BE PUMPED OUT OF THESE SYSTEMS AND THEN THE BOAT WOULD BE PULLED FROM THE WATER, COMPLETING THE DECONTAMINATION PROCESS. WATER REMAINING IN THE DIP TANK WOULD BE CONTINUOUSLY FILTERED AND RETURNED TO THE TANK, ENSURING LARVAL MUSSELS, DEBRIS, OIL, AND OTHER POTENTIAL CONTAMINANTS ARE REMOVED PRIOR TO THE ENTRANCE OF THE NEXT WATERCRAFT.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL CONTINUE TO ADVANCE THE MANY OBJECTIVE ROBUST DECISION MAKING  MORDM  FRAMEWORK THAT IS EXPECTED TO PROVIDE MULTIPLE BENEFITS TO THE COLORADO RIVER BASIN  CRB  STAKEHOLDERS  TECHNICAL STAFF AND DECISION MAKERS IN AGENCIES, SUCH AS THE CENTRAL ARIZONA WATER CONSERVANCY DISTRICT, THE METROPOLITAN WATER DISTRICT, THE UPPER COLORADO RIVER COMMISSION, THE STATE OF WYOMING, THE WESTERN AREA POWER ADMINISTRATION, TRIBES, NON GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS, ETC , REQUIRE ADVANCED TECHNICAL INFORMATION AS THEY EXPLORE POTENTIAL NEW POLICIES  IN PARTICULAR, THE INFORMATION AND METHODS THAT INCORPORATE ROBUSTNESS AND ADAPTATION WILL BE EXTREMELY VALUABLE TO A NEGOTIATION PROCESS THAT MUST CONTEND WITH UNCERTAINTY OVER THE COURSE OF THE EARLIER STUDIES, RECLAMATION AND RESEARCHERS IDENTIFIED MULTIPLE OPPORTUNITIES TO INCREASE THE BENEFITS OF THE MORDM FRAMEWORK  THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL EXPAND ON PREVIOUS EFFORTS IN THE FOLLOWING WAYS  EMPLOYING ADVANCED ANALYSES ON PERFORMANCE AND ROBUSTNESS DATA, INCORPORATING ROBUSTNESS CONSIDERATIONS INTO THE POLICY SEARCH, IDENTIFYING ADAPTATION TRIGGERS, AND EXPLORING HOW ADAPTATIVE POLICIES CAN INCREASE SYSTEM RELIABILITY IN THE FACE OF UNCERTAINTY IN YEAR 1, THE TEAM WILL BUILD ON ITS UNDERSTANDING OF RECENT RESEARCH IN ADAPTIVE DECISION MAKING, UTILIZING ROBUST OPTIMIZATION AS A MEANS TO GENERATE DIVERSE POLICIES TO INCREASE CRB ADAPTABILITY  IN YEAR 2, THE TEAM WILL PROCESS RESULTS OF MULTIPLE ROBUST OPTIMIZATION TRIALS, UTILIZING THOSE POLICIES IN A TIME VARYING ADAPTIVE POLICYMAKING PROTOCOL

PROJECT ABSTRACT TEMPLATEAWARD PURPOSE: THIS AGREEMENT WILL CONTINUE THE PROJECTS FOR THE ROGUE RIVER HABITAT RESTORATION PROGRAM: CONSOLIDATED PROJECT COMPLETION, MONITORING & STEWARDSHIP.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROPOSED PROJECT ACTIVITIES TO BE FUNDED THROUGH THIS AWARD INCLUDE:INSTREAM HABITAT/LWM PROJECTS VISUALLY ASSESS PROJECT PERFORMANCE AT LWM PROJECT SITES 2 TO 3 TIMES PER YEAR. SITE VISITS WILL OCCUR DURING OR IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWING GREATER-THAN-BANK FULL EVENTS TO ASSESS CHANGES IN STRUCTURE PERFORMANCE OR RISK. SURVEYORS WILL WALK THE ENTIRE SITE AND RECORD INFORMATION INTENDED TO PROVIDE A GENERAL ASSESSMENT OF WHETHER THE PROJECT IS ON TRACK TO ACHIEVE QUANTITATIVE PERFORMANCE STANDARDS AS WELL AS THE CHALLENGES TO ATTAINING THOSE STANDARDS (E.G., HEALTH OF NATIVE SPECIES, COMPETITION FROM INVASIVE SPECIES, BROWSE AND WILDLIFE USE, SOILS AND EROSION, INSECTS AND DISEASE, OTHER CONDITIONS INCLUDING FIRE). THE SCOPE OF WORK UNDER THIS AGREEMENT IS TO CONDUCT DESIGN, CONSTRUCTION, AND COMMISSIONING OF A HORIZONTAL FISH SCREEN BELOW THE HEADWORKS OF THE TRUCKEE CANAL AT DERBY DAM. THE FISH SCREEN IS A SYSTEM OF COMPONENTS WHICH IS MADE UP OF THE FISH SCREEN STRUCTURE AND APPURTENANCES.  COMPONENTS THAT MAKE UP THE FISH SCREEN STRUCTURE INCLUDES, BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO, THE ATTENUATION BAY, TAPER WALLS, SCREEN MATERIAL, AND WEIR WALLS.  THE APPURTENANT STRUCTURES INCLUDE INLET FLUMES, GATE STRUCTURES, FISH RETURN STRUCTURES, CONVEYANCE FLUMES, BYPASS STRUCTURES, AS WELL AS BUILDINGS AND OTHER STRUCTURE REQUIRED FOR THE PROPER OPERATION OF THE FISH SCREEN.
